marketNews.title: China Announces Retaliatory Tariffs, Trade War Continues
marketNews.content: China today, Tuesday (4/3), announced additional retaliatory tariffs of approximately 10-15% for US imported products effective March 10, 2025, marking the country's second round of retaliation against the US following the 10% retaliatory tariff that took effect on February 10, 2025. This announcement followed the implementation of an additional 10% import tariff by the US on imports originating from China effective today, which brings the total import tariff on goods from China to 20%. In addition to China, the US also began imposing import tariffs of 25% on Canada and Mexico effective today, except for energy products from Canada which are only subject to a 10% tariff. In response to this, Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau immediately imposed 25% retaliatory tariffs on 30 billion Canadian dollars worth of US imports, and threatened to impose these tariffs on another 125 billion Canadian dollars worth of US imports if the US does not repeal the tariffs within 21 days. Previously, the imposition of import tariffs on Canada and Mexico was postponed for one month pending negotiations to strengthen border controls between the countries to meet US demands regarding overcoming the flow of narcotics into the US. However, Trump stated that narcotics from both neighboring countries were still entering at a very high and unacceptable level. The tariffs on Canada and Mexico, as well as the additional tariffs for China, are only part of Trump's protectionist policies, which plan a number of tariffs on specific or regional commodities. Previously, Trump planned to impose a 25% import tariff on iron and aluminum commodities effective March 12, 2025. He also proposed a 25% tariff on imports of cars, medicines, semiconductors, and wood. Besides specific commodities, Trump also threatened to impose retaliatory tariffs on countries that hinder US trade, and recently mentioned imposing a 25% tariff on imports of cars and everything else from the European Union. Amid these tariff plans, Bloomberg reported last week that the scope and deadlines for the tariff plans announced by Trump remain unclear. For example, it is still unknown whether tariffs on specific commodities will be included as part of regional tariffs or implemented separately. On Monday (3/3), the US Dollar Index (DXY) fell -0.81% to the level of 106.7 and all US stock market indices closed weaker, with the S&P 500 at -1.76%, Dow Jones Index at -1.48%, and Nasdaq at -2.2%. This weakening occurred before China announced additional retaliatory tariffs for the US. In Indonesia, the IHSG also closed weaker at -2.14% today, with the Indonesian government bond yield for the 10-year tenor flat at 6.85% (-2 bps) and the Rupiah exchange rate against the US Dollar slightly strengthening by +0.21% to the level of 16,445.

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway
marketNews.content: The escalation of the trade war is once again increasing global economic uncertainty and the prospect of interest rate cuts. On one hand, additional tariffs from the US on other countries have the potential to drive up prices and inflation in the US. On the other hand, retaliatory tariffs against the US could weaken its exports and the economy. These two dynamics will be factors influencing the direction of interest rates by the Fed. As of today, analysis from the CME FedWatch Tool shows that the probability of a US interest rate cut of more than 50 bps during 2025 rose to 68% from 41% a week ago. Amid increasing uncertainty and its impact on Indonesian capital market volatility, investors can consider locking in yields on short-term FR bonds such as PBS003 (tenor ~2 years) which offers a yield of 6.37% per year today. On the other hand, investors with higher risk appetite can consider quality stocks that are currently correcting, such as Bank Central Asia ($BBCA).

tickerNews.title: Prajogo Pangestu Buys 11 Million BRPT Shares
tickerNews.content: $BRPT: The controller and President Commissioner of Barito Pacific, Prajogo Pangestu, purchased 11 million BRPT shares at an average price of 790.09 rupiah per share on February 28, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 8.7 billion rupiah. After this transaction, Prajogo Pangestu's ownership in BRPT increased from 71.35% to 71.36%.

tickerNews.title: Elang Mahkota Teknologi Logs Share Purchase in Surya Citra Media
tickerNews.content: $SCMA: The controller of Surya Citra Media, Elang Mahkota Teknologi ($EMTK), purchased approximately 297 million SCMA shares at an average price of approximately 205 rupiah per share between February 14 and March 3, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 60.7 billion rupiah. After this transaction, EMTK's ownership in SCMA increased from 62.31% to 62.72%.

tickerNews.title: XL Axiata Proposes 2024 Dividend Payout
tickerNews.content: $EXCL: XL Axiata proposed a dividend for the 2024 fiscal year amounting to 1.12 trillion rupiah or 85.7 rupiah per share in the AGM agenda to be held on March 25, 2025. This amount is equivalent to a 62% dividend payout ratio, with an indicative dividend yield of 3.9% based on the share price as of Tuesday (4/3) at 2,200 rupiah per share.

tickerNews.title: United Tractors January 2025 Sales and Production Figures
tickerNews.content: $UNTR: United Tractors recorded Komatsu brand heavy equipment sales of 536 units in January 2025 (+129.1% MoM, +3.5% YoY) with a market share of 29% (vs. FY24: 26%, 1M24: 34%), equivalent to 11.7% of the 2025 target of 4,600 units. In the mining contractor segment, UNTR recorded a coal production volume of 10.1 million tons in January 2025 (-9% MoM, +1% YoY), with overburden removal at 78.6 million bcm (-11.6% MoM, -12.1% YoY).

tickerNews.title: Adaro Minerals Indonesia Q4 2024 Net Profit and Production Volume
tickerNews.content: $ADMR: Adaro Minerals Indonesia recorded a net profit of 105 million US dollars in 4Q24 (+25.8% QoQ, -45.1% YoY). This result brought the net profit for 2024 to 437 million US dollars (-1% YoY). The quarterly increase in net profit in 4Q24 was caused by a revenue increase of +33.9% QoQ. On the other hand, the surge in cost of revenue (+35% QoQ) and operating expenses (+69.5% QoQ) caused the operating profit margin to fall to 41.5% in 4Q24 (vs. 3Q24: 42.7%). In 4Q24, ADMR recorded a production volume of 1.77 million tons (-4.3% QoQ) with a sales volume of 1.81 million tons (+50.8% QoQ), resulting in a total production volume in 2024 of 6.6 million tons (+29.4% YoY) with a sales volume of 5.6 million tons (+24.4% YoY).

tickerNews.title: Lawrence Barki Increases Ownership in Harum Energy
tickerNews.content: $HRUM: The President Commissioner of Harum Energy, Lawrence Barki, purchased approximately 6.6 million HRUM shares at an average price of approximately 737 rupiah per share on February 27-28, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 4.9 billion rupiah. After this transaction, Lawrence Barki's ownership in HRUM increased from 0.047% to 0.097%.

tickerNews.title: Ciputra Development Sets 2025 Marketing Sales Target and Incentivized Housing Supply Acceleration
tickerNews.content: $CTRA: Ciputra Development set a marketing sales target of 11 trillion rupiah during 2025 (vs. 2024 target: 11.1 trillion rupiah), equivalent to the marketing sales realization in 2024. CTRA will also accelerate construction to increase the supply of houses qualifying for the government-borne VAT incentive (PPN DTP), targeting additional house units valued at least up to 2 trillion rupiah.

tickerNews.title: ABM Investama Acquires Coal Mining Entities from United Tractors
tickerNews.content: $ABMM: ABM Investama through its subsidiary, PT Reswara Minergi Hartama, signed an agreement to acquire the entire ownership in 2 coal mining business entities of United Tractors ($UNTR), namely PT Borneo Berkat Makmur and PT Piranti Jaya Utama, with a total transaction value of 57 million US dollars. Of this amount, the transaction value with UNTR reached 34.2 million US dollars. This transaction is aimed at increasing ABMM's coal reserve portfolio. PT Borneo Berkat Makmur itself owns 60% of the shares in PT Piranti Jaya Utama, while PT Piranti Jaya Utama is a coal mining company in Kapuas, Central Kalimantan.

tickerNews.title: Pantai Indah Kapuk Dua Q4 2024 Net Profit and Full Year 2024 Performance
tickerNews.content: $PANI: Pantai Indah Kapuk Dua recorded a net profit of 137 billion rupiah in 4Q24 (vs. 4Q23: 15 billion rupiah net profit, 3Q24: 202 billion rupiah net profit). This result brought the net profit for 2024 to 624 billion rupiah (+131% YoY). The growth in net profit in 4Q24 was supported by revenue growth (+73% YoY, -1% QoQ) due to the increase in marketing sales and handover of land plots (47% of revenue). Meanwhile, the gross profit margin in 4Q24 reached 52.6% (+530 bps YoY, -680 bps QoQ). PANI itself recorded marketing sales growth of +156% YoY during 2024 to the level of 6 trillion rupiah.

tickerNews.title: Bangun Kosambi Sukses Logs Strong Full Year 2024 Net Profit and Margin Expansion
tickerNews.content: $CBDK: Bangun Kosambi Sukses recorded a net profit of 925 billion rupiah during 2024 (+60% YoY). This result was supported by revenue growth (+15% YoY) in line with land plot handover (48% of revenue). CBDK also recorded gross profit margin expansion to 56.6% in 2024 (+610 bps YoY).

tickerNews.title: Ultrajaya Milk Q4 2024 Net Profit Driven by Forex Gains Despite Operating Expense Rise
tickerNews.content: $ULTJ: Ultrajaya Milk Industry & Trading Company recorded a net profit of 255 billion rupiah in 4Q24 (+11% YoY, +103% QoQ). This result made the net profit for 2024 reach 1.14 trillion rupiah (-3% YoY). Although revenue (+5% YoY, +7% QoQ) and gross profit margin (+260 bps YoY, +80 bps QoQ) grew in 4Q24, ULTJ's operating profit decreased (-22% YoY, -34% QoQ) due to the increase in advertising and promotion expenses (+69% YoY, +86% QoQ). The growth in net profit in 4Q24 was mainly supported by exchange rate gains and other income amounting to 127 billion rupiah (vs. 4Q23: profit 4 billion rupiah, 3Q24: loss 170 billion rupiah).

tickerNews.title: Garibaldi Thohir Calls for Buying Opportunities Amid IHSG Decline, Citing Good Fundamentals of Domestic Companies
tickerNews.content: President Director of Alamtri Resources Indonesia ($ADRO), Garibaldi 'Boy' Thohir, called for "it's time to buy" following the downward trend of the IHSG since early 2025. Boy Thohir on Monday (3/3) stated that many domestic companies have good fundamentals and cheap values.

tickerNews.title: Government to Execute 21 Strategic Projects Worth $40 Billion Funded by Danantara, Including DME, Oil Storage, and Refinery Projects
tickerNews.content: Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources, Bahlil Lahadalia, said on Monday (3/3) that the government will immediately execute 21 strategic projects with a total investment value of 40 billion US dollars, which will be funded by the Indonesia Investment Authority (Danantara). This step is part of the investment plan for the downstreaming program in the energy and mineral resources sector amounting to 618 billion US dollars until 2040. Some projects to be realized immediately include the construction of a dimethyl ether (DME) plant for coal gasification into LPG fuel, crude oil storage construction on Nipah Island, and the construction of an oil refinery with a capacity of approximately 500,000 barrels. Bahlil claimed that the government currently does not need foreign investors to carry out these projects, following the withdrawal of Air Products and Chemicals Inc. from the coal gasification project with Bukit Asam ($PTBA) in 2023.

tickerNews.title: Government Involves State-Owned Banks to Fund Village Cooperatives for Free Lunch Program
tickerNews.content: Coordinating Minister for Food Affairs, Zulkifli Hasan, stated on Monday (3/3) that the government will involve state-owned bank associations (Himbara) to finance a new cooperative program under President Prabowo Subianto's administration. The government itself will establish 70,000 'Merah Putih' village cooperatives this year, intended to channel raw materials for the free lunch program in every village. Zulkifli Hasan claimed that the establishment of these cooperatives requires funds of 3-5 billion rupiah per village, which will be financed by the village fund budget of 1 billion rupiah per year for each village and the remainder using financing from Himbara with a tenor of 3-5 years.

tickerNews.title: OPEC+ to Proceed with Planned April 2025 Oil Production Hike, First Since 2022
tickerNews.content: Reuters reported on Monday (3/3) that OPEC+ will remain on track to proceed with the planned oil production recovery starting in April 2025, as planned announced in December 2024. This will mark the first production increase by OPEC+ since 2022. Based on Reuters estimates, this production recovery will boost output by 138,000 barrels per day. Nevertheless, OPEC+ stated that the oil production recovery could be temporarily halted or canceled depending on market conditions, aimed at enabling OPEC+ to continue supporting oil market stability.

tickerNews.title: Maroef Sjamsoeddin Appointed as President Director of MIND ID
tickerNews.content: Maroef Sjamsoeddin was appointed as the president director of MIND ID, replacing Hendi Prio Santoso, who held the position since October 2021. Maroef is a retired Indonesian Air Force officer, and previously served as the president director of PT Freeport Indonesia in 2015-2016. Maroef is also the younger brother of the Minister of Defense, Sjafrie Sjamsoeddin.

tickerNews.title: Medco Energi Announces Hydrocarbon Discovery in Rimau Block
tickerNews.content: Medco Energi Internasional ($MEDC) through its subsidiary, PT Medco E & P Rimau, announced hydrocarbon discoveries in the Rimau Block, South Sumatra, although it did not detail the magnitude further. The President Director of PT Medco E & P Indonesia, Ronald Gunawan, stated that they will cooperate with SKK Migas to further evaluate the commercial potential of the discovery.

tickerNews.title: Petrosea Plans Bond and Sukuk Issuance Up to Rp1 Trillion and Rp500 Billion Respectively
tickerNews.content: $PTRO: Petrosea plans to issue bonds up to 1 trillion rupiah and sukuk up to 500 billion rupiah, with the funds intended for the purchase of materials and services, labor costs, and other operating expenses. The bonds and sukuk consist of 3 series each (tenors of 3 years, 5 years, and 7 years) with interest/profit rates of 7.75%, 8.75%, and 9.3% respectively. The bonds and sukuk have received an idA+ and idA+(sy) rating from Pefindo, respectively. The public offering period is estimated to take place on March 13-17, 2025.

tickerNews.title: Bayan Resources Targets 2025 Revenue of $4.1-4.4 Billion with Higher Coal Sales Volume
tickerNews.content: Kontan reported that Bayan Resources ($BYAN) targets revenue of approximately 4.1-4.4 billion US dollars during 2025 (vs. 2024 realization: 3.44 billion US dollars). To achieve this target, BYAN targets coal sales volume of approximately 70-72 million tons (vs. 2024 realization: 56.2 million tons), with a target production volume in the range of 69-72 million tons (vs. 2024 realization: 56.9 million tons). On the capital expenditure side, BYAN budgeted capex of approximately 200-300 million US dollars in 2025 (vs. 2024 capex allocation: 230-260 million US dollars).

tickerNews.title: Apexindo Wins 45-Day Offshore Drilling Contract in Mahakam Delta
tickerNews.content: Apexindo Pratama Duta ($APEX) obtained an offshore drilling service contract worth 2.4 million US dollars in the Mahakam Delta area, East Kalimantan, from PT Pertamina Hulu Mahakam with a duration of 45 days.
